intro: Dorstenia elliptica, commonly known as the "Cucumber Plant," is a tropical species belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its elongated, fleshy leaves that resemble cucumber slices, hence its common name. Its flowers are small, yellow, and clustered in panicles, often appearing after the leaves. Dorstenia elliptica is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and ability to thrive in partial shade.
